resources.string: To get started, please choose one of the following options:
Save the PIN to internal storage. If you want to use widgets, this is required.
Enable this if you have trouble with the widget freezing. Android will raise the widget\'s priority but may also display an annoying notification.
Easy Token is an RSA SecurID-compatible authenticator with advanced usability features.\n
If you do not have an RSA software token or are not sure what this is used for, you may safely uninstall the app.\n
Easy Token supports both lock screen widgets and home screen widgets. First import your token, then enter your PIN. Then follow these instructions to install the widget:\n

- Lock screen widget: available on Android 4.2 through 4.4. Not available on Android \"L\". Watch [this video](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZpN8Wyu_z6Y) and [this video](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NRRbjlXQluc) for an introduction.

- See also: special instructions for [Samsung](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fbzcy7NxBuE) and [HTC](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QZZjBuqQvZk). If the standard instructions do not work, you may need to search for directions for your specific device.
- Home screen widget: for Android 4.3 or earlier watch [this video](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mihmN_mZU4c); for Android 4.4+ watch [this video](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q_xKlp7ehnY).
- To resize a home screen widget, long-press the widget and then release. Then drag the outline to adjust the boundaries.
- Some Android versions miscalculate the widget\'s size, resulting in a distorted image. If this happens, delete the widget and re-create it.

- You may delete the clock widget from the lock screen and place Easy Token on the main lock screen, if desired. Clicking on the Easy Token lock screen widget will toggle between tokencode mode and clock mode.

Please use Easy Token responsibly and avoid taking unnecessary risks with sensitive data. All software tokens are at risk of theft by malware; for high-security applications a hardware token is strongly preferred.\n
Saving your PIN is convenient, but can be risky if your device is stolen.\n

If you use the lock screen widget, your tokencode is available to anybody with access to your phone (even if they cannot unlock it). For this case, you may want to ask your system administrator to issue a 6-digit PIN-less software token, which will require you to enter PIN + TOKENCODE when logging in, instead of just a tokencode.
Copyright 2012-2014 Kevin Cernekee <[cernekee@gmail.com](mailto:cernekee@gmail.com)>\nThis is free software with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY.
For details see the COPYING file in the source distribution.\n
Source code and issue tracking can be found at:
Enter the PIN that you normally use with this token. If you are setting up a newly issued token with no PIN, click \"No PIN\" and follow the instructions provided by your system administrator.
This changes the PIN used locally to calculate your tokencode. It will NOT automatically change the PIN on your account.
I have an \'http\' link or \'sdtid\' file attachment in my email.
I copied an \'sdtid\' file to my Android device over USB.
Manual entry or paste from clipboard.

To import an \"sdtid\" XML file that is attached to an email, click on the attachment and select \"Import token\". If that doesn\'t work, you can copy it to external storage via USB and then directly import the file.\n\nTo import a link in any of these formats, click on the blue underlined link from your email client and then select \"Import token\":
The \"Next\" button will become active once a valid token string is entered. To paste, long-press the input area.
Unable to read the token file:
Unable to parse the token file. Please contact your system administrator.
Unable to parse the token string. Please contact your system administrator.\n\nToken:
Importing a QR code requires Barcode Scanner, a free app. Would you like to install it?
Enter the password for this token:
The supplied device ID is incorrect.
The supplied password or bound device ID is incorrect.
